intro: Psychotria nautensis, commonly known as the sea psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of the Caribbean. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species with ornamental and medicinal value. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in sandy soils near the shoreline. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, displaying a range of colors from white to pink. Psychotria nautensis is notable for its adaptability to saline and coastal environments.
